newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZOG says Chevril-6 drilling to continue.
newsitem.headline: NZOG says Chevril-6 drilling to continue.

text.p: New Zealand Oil and Gas Group said on Wednesday that, following drilling of the Chervil-6 "pilot hole", the joint venture had agreed to proceed with the drilling of the horizontal production well in order to access the remaining oil within the Chervil field.

New Zealand Oil and Gas has a 23 percent interest in Chervil-6. It said drilling of the vertical "pilot hole" had been completed and had shown that oil had moved up in the reservoir much as expected giving encouragement that sufficient quantities of oil are present at the top of the reservoir.
"A horizontal well will be drilled with the objective of maximising the drainage rate and recovery of remaining oil," the company said in a statement.
"Drilling of the horizontal well is expected to be completed within 10 to 12 days, with production commencing immediately thereafter."
Chervil-6 is located in the Carnarvon Basin off the north-west coast of Western Australia.
New Zealand Oil and Gas Ltd -- 23.166 percent (via 56 percent owned subsidiary Pan Pacific Petroleum).
